In the days since the Mueller report was released, the Trump administration has asked the courts to stop the House Oversight Committee from seeking documents about the president's financial ties.

The White House directed a former official who supervised security clearances for Jared Kushner and Ivanka Trump not to comply with a House subpoena that he appear for a deposition today.

And yesterday, the 5PM passed with the Secretary of Treasury refusing to hand over the president's tax returns despite the law clearly stating that the Secretary of the Treasury shall furnish the information to the Ways and Means committee chairman.

Medicare-For-All has been a rising buzzword amongst Democratic candidates for president. And a recent Kaiser poll shows that a majority of Americans, 56%, and 81% of Democrats support a national health care plan. Candidates have pitched a variety of ways to overhaul health care in the United States, They range from entirely replacing private insurance companies with a government plan to giving all Americans the option to buy into Medicare or lowering the age that Medicare kicks in.
